decks.notes: This deck aims to overwhelm the opponent quickly with a mix of cheap, efficient creatures and spells that can boost their power. The key focus is on speeding up the deck with cards like Jegantha, the Wellspring and Dragon's Rage Channeler, while also maintaining card advantage through cards like Mishra's Bauble and Expressive Iteration. The goal is to apply pressure early and often, utilizing cards like Mutagenic Growth and Lightning Bolt to clear the way for your creatures to attack and close out the game quickly.

The Gruul Aggro deck focuses on fast, aggressive gameplay by using low-cost creatures and burn spells to quickly reduce the opponent's life total. It also utilizes cards like Mishra's Bauble and Dragon's Rage Channeler to generate card advantage and maintain tempo. The inclusion of Jegantha, the Wellspring as a companion adds an extra layer of versatility to the deck. By combining efficient creatures with direct damage spells, the deck aims to overwhelm the opponent and secure a swift victory.

This deck focuses on playing aggressively with Rakdos colored cards to disrupt the opponent's hand while applying strong pressure on the board. Using cards like Grief and Thoughtseize to strip the opponent's hand of key cards, while deploying powerful threats like Ragavan, Nimble Pilferer and Dauthi Voidwalker to close out the game quickly. Removal spells like Fatal Push and Terminate help control the board, while cards like Fable of the Mirror-Breaker provide additional value. This deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with fast, efficient plays and disrupt their game plan at every turn.

This deck focuses on quickly reducing the opponent's life total using high-value creatures like Death's Shadow and Murktide Regent, while disrupting their game plan with hand disruption spells like Thoughtseize and Counterspell. The deck also utilizes versatile removal spells like Dismember and Fatal Push to control the board and protect its threats. The combination of aggressive creatures, disruption, and removal allows for a fast-paced gameplay style that aims to overwhelm the opponent before they can establish their strategy.

This mono black control deck focuses on resource denial and disruption through hand disruption cards like Inquisition of Kozilek and Thoughtseize, as well as targeted removal like Fatal Push. The deck also utilizes powerful planeswalkers like Karn, the Great Creator to control the board and win the game. In addition, the deck includes utility lands like Field of Ruin and Cabal Coffers to further disrupt the opponent's game plan. The win condition of the deck is to control the game until it can play and protect The One Ring to secure victory.

The deck focuses on quickly overwhelming the opponent with aggressive creatures like Dauthi Voidwalker, Ragavan, Nimble Pilferer, and Orcish Bowmasters, while disrupting their game plan with cards like Thoughtseize and Grief. It also utilizes key removal spells like Fatal Push, Terminate, Lightning Bolt, and Sheoldred's Edict to clear the way for its creatures to attack. The deck's mana base is optimized for consistent and fast plays, with a mix of fetch lands, shock lands, and utility lands. The overall strategy is to apply pressure early and maintain control of the game until victory is achieved.

This Jund Aggro deck focuses on utilizing efficient creatures like Ragavan, Nimble Pilferer and Tarmogoyf, backed up by disruptive spells like Thoughtseize and Inquisition of Kozilek. The deck also includes powerful planeswalkers like Wrenn and Six to generate card advantage while applying pressure. Urza's Saga is used to tutor up key artifacts, while cards like Lightning Bolt and Fatal Push provide removal options. The deck aims to quickly apply pressure to the opponent while disrupting their game plan, ultimately overwhelming them with a combination of threats and disruption.
